docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 13 Galo Plaza Lasso, a former President of Ecuador and United Nations special envoy, announced today his candidacy for the role of Secretary General of the organization of American States.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 13 Galo Plaza Lasso, a former President of Ecuador and United Nations special envoy, announced today his candidacy for the role of Secretary General of the organization of American States.
docs.abstract: G Plaza Lasso (Ecuador) announces candidacy for Sec Gen; denies being US 'choice'; US reptdly sees him well suited for post but fears premature endorsement would jeopardize candidacy; Mora reptdly would like to retain post after term expires in Nov

headline.main: ECUADORIAN SEEKS TOP POST IN O.A.S.; Galo Plaza, Ex-President, Favors Strong Grouping

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WELLES Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: THE Center for Inter-American Relations at  680 Park Avenue is a new private organization designed to achieve a closer relationship between Latin Americans and North Americans. "Precursors of Modernism, 1860-1930," the first of its series of art...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Center for Inter-American Relations at 680 Park Avenue is a new private organization designed to achieve a closer relationship between Latin Americans and North Americans. "Precursors of Modernism, 1860-1930," the first of its series of art exhibitions with the over-all title "Artists of the Western Hemisphere," is open to the public today.
docs.abstract: Precursors of Modernism, 1860-1930, show of Latin and N Amer artists (Inter-Amer Relations Center)

headline.main: Art: From the Americas; Precursors of Modernism' Opens Series at Inter-American Relations Center

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, Sept. 16--The first government-sponsored American conference on population problems ended today. It called on the LatinAmerican nations to support "to the extent of their capabilities" the development of clinical programs for...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, Sept. 16--The first government-sponsored American conference on population problems ended today. It called on the LatinAmerican nations to support "to the extent of their capabilities" the development of clinical programs for family planning.
docs.abstract: Rept issued to Latin-Amer family planning conf, Caracas, Venezuela, urges family planning and med services for all income levels to cut rate of induced abortion, 1 main cause of maternal deaths

headline.main: FAMILY PLANNING URGED ON LATINS; Caracas Parley Calls For Action by Governments

docs.snippet: CARACAS--The women of Latin America, from the wretched hillside slums of Lima to the dusty Bolivian lowlands, call it "la sonda"--the probe. Doctors call it "el carnicero"--"the butcher."
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS--The women of Latin America, from the wretched hillside slums of Lima to the dusty Bolivian lowlands, call it "la sonda"--the probe. Doctors call it "el carnicero"--"the butcher."

headline.main: Population; For the Latins the Birth Rate Spells Disaster Cause of Death The Next Step

docs.snippet: KAYSERI, Turkey, Sept. 17-- Forty-two persons were killed and about 600 injured today when a riot broke out among spectators at a soccer game in this provincial capital 165 miles east-southeast of Ankara.
docs.lead_paragraph: KAYSERI, Turkey, Sept. 17-- Forty-two persons were killed and about 600 injured today when a riot broke out among spectators at a soccer game in this provincial capital 165 miles east-southeast of Ankara.
docs.abstract: 42 killed, about 600 hurt, as spectators riot, Kayseri, Turkey, during match with team from Sivas; map

headline.main: 42 Are Killed and 600 Injured In Riot at Turkish Soccer Game; 42 KILLED IN RIOT AT SOCCER GAME
